summary: With U.S. crude oil production nearly doubling from 2009 to 2015, Congress repealed the crude oil export ban in December 2015—allowing the free export of U.S. crude oil worldwide. We found that repealing the ban was associated with: Expanding the market for U.S. crude oil to overseas buyers Allowing producers to charge higher prices relative to comparable foreign oil Decreasing profit margins for petroleum refiners...
title: Crude Oil Markets: Effects of the Repeal of the Crude Oil Export Ban
